data.title: Fixed the loading on non-lowercase content files on case sensitive platforms
data.body:
Fixes #2727, which was introduced in #2721

@vmachacek Please test it :)

data.title: Mouse doesn't get updated outside the window on a MonoGame Windows Project.
SoundBank does not support Volume Variation
data.body:
Calling PlayCue or GetCue on SoundBank will result in a NotSupportedException when the Cue has Vol Var. enabled (Volume Variation).

> Additional information: Specified method is not supported.

data.title: Handle touches going off our UIElement in Win8
data.body:
See #1198 for the bug details.

There are 2 possible ways to fix this:
- Listen to PointerExited events and count these as a PointerRelease.
- 'Capture' the pointer when it is pressed, this means that we get the events for it even if it is dragged off our element. I chose this fix.

I also added listening to the PointerCanceled event as we don't get PointerReleased events in certain other situations

Docs:
http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.uielement.capturepointer
http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/windows.ui.xaml.uielement.pointercanceled

data.title: Adding Pipeline Tool To Installer
data.body:
This mainly adds the Pipeline GUI tool to the Windows installer.
- We now install all tools to a common /Tools subfolder.
- Added shortcut to Pipeline Tool.
- Added shortcuts for docs, support, and bug reporting.
- Did some cleanups in the installer script.
- The Pipeline tool builds into its own folders now.

data.title: MGFX Fix + Tests
Auto-generate link to implementation. [Docs]
data.body:
I've started browsing the monogame.net docs (thank you for something I can use, and not just cloning the beast of MSDN) and many times wish there were a link to the implementation of whatever I was browsing at the moment.

I've not taken a look at documentation generation (if any exist at all) so I do now know how feasible this is.

data.title: Refactor ToString()s
data.body:
We need to make a pass refactoring all MonoGame `ToString()` overloads to do the following:
- Implement missing `ToString()` overloads.
- Write unit tests to verify correct XNA formatting on math types like Vector3 and Rectangle.
- Replace all `string.Format()`s with `"fast" + "string" + "concatenation"`.

data.title: FontProcessor Generates Bad Kerning Data
data.body:
The new FreeType/SharpFont based FontProcessor produces very different kerning data than stock Microsoft XNA.  In cases things like character height can be off by 10-20 pixels depending on font size.

It could be acceptable if you are designing your game against MonoGame and the new FontProcessor.  But if you are porting a game from XNA to MonoGame and depend on `SpriteFont.MeasureString()`, then you will get lots of misaligned text.

data.title: Android crash (apparently not very important)
data.body:
Hi!

In AndroidGameWindow.cs, this line

Game.Activity.RequestedOrientation = requestedOrientation;

causes a crash.

To reproduce it, exit any app so that Activity is set to null and then, once in the "android home" just turn the phone (it may take some turns to crash). As the app has exited and activity destroyed, I suppose it has no effect to app lifecycle as next time will just start the app again.

Noticed as part of #2738
Have ran on desktop DirectX.

data.title: GraphicsAdapter.CurrentDisplayMode for windows directx
data.body: Fixes #2619

data.title: Ensure struct enumerator on TouchCollection
data.body: Follow up task from #2735

data.title: Fixed music volume on WP8
data.body:
Unlike other volume implementations, MediaElement uses a linear scale. This means that if you set the volume to 50%, it will not be half as loud, but it will be almost totally silent instead. The approximation of using the 4th root seems to work well.

See discussion for further details:
http://community.monogame.net/t/wp8-music-volume/178

data.title: Tidy up unnecessary Linq usages
data.body:
This PR removes `using System.Linq` statements and replaces Linq with plain loops or different calls in a few places.

As part of removing Linq from TouchCollection I lined it up with WP7 behaviour (doesn't allow null in the constructor) and gave it its own Enumerator Implementation to match XNA also.

Have split this in to 3 commits so they can be reviewed individually as necessary.
ec6c4afe821bf2b798965a07786051ff4782a200 is just removing using statements.
65647cb31547b5410740c8e354a9886b3084566d is replacing Linq usages.
7899705d680f2bad8de6243d48c606f2a13ac706 is the TouchCollection touch-up.

TouchCollection ref: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.xna.framework.input.touch.touchcollection.getenumerator.aspx
Refs #2717

data.title: Method not found: 'Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GameComponent.get_GraphicsDevice'."
data.body: When I call Game.Initialize, I get the missing method exception for GameComponent.get_GraphicsDevice.  I pulled this on the evening of the 19th.  I find it odd that I was able to compile this.

data.title: Changed iOS Twitter API to use UIImage
data.body:
Changed iOS Twitter API to use `UIImage` instead of `string`, as requested here:
https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/2718

Bonus warning fix: Corrected the XML comment documentation for `ShowMatchMaker` so that it no longer generates an invalid XML warning.

data.title: Android: SoundEffect.Play audio stopped by other samples
data.body:
Hi!

when playing a sample in android before a first sample stops playing, the first sample is stopped before playing the second sample.

I've created an small example which provokes the problem: http://online.ru-zero.com/files/audioTest.zip

Just press "Audio 1" and afterwards, "audio 2". When pressing audio 2, the first sample is stopped.

The problem appears in Galaxy Tab 3 and Nexus 5 (the only two devices I've been able to test it it)

data.title: Added missing texture reload for DirectX
data.body: This wasn't implemented yet

data.title: Delta time property
data.body: Ok, so its recreation of https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/2729 but without performance reducing FPS.

data.title: Time improvements
data.body: I think this commit is reasonable addition and can decrease amount of time developers spends on write own implementation or copy/paste process. Ironically, this time spends on time. Why not added DeltaTime property for easy and understandable way of applying delta time ? And why not FPS when every single game uses it ?

data.title: WP8 SaveAsJpeg bug
data.body:
Hi!

I found a bug in SaveAsJpeg in WP8. When using it, the image writes only 1/4 of the image 

In example, my image is 800x480, then for each row, it writes 200 pixels instead of 800. Due to the lack of data , the last 3/4 of the image is just gray)

The problem is in PlatformGetData<T> in Texture2D.DirectX.cs , When querying

var elementSize = SharpDX.Utilities.SizeOf<T>();

this value returns 1 always. I think this is due to PlatformSaveAsJpeg creating a new byte[] instead of a new Color[], or whatever size the SurfaceFormat should have. Then, "T" has a size = 1 and the effect described at the start is produced.

data.title: Fixed possible ArgumentNullException in ContentTypeReaderManager.
data.body: ContentTypeReader.TargetType can be null, e.g. for ExternalReferenceReader.

data.title: MGFX Fixes
data.body:
This first fixes an issue with using `float.Parse()` (and potentially `int.Parse()`) on a system where the culture was something other than en-us.  These numbers should always be parsed in a culture invariant way on all platforms. Thanks to [Backlash](http://www.codeplex.com/site/users/view/Backlash) for pointing this out to me!

As part of fixing this I found that we were incorrectly parsing the Number type for sampler or render states in MGFX.  It was requiring a leading `+` or `-` instead of making it optional.  Not sure how this slipped thru for so long other than very few people are using sampler or render states that take a numeric value.

data.title: Property Game.Activity read only, mismatch in SetContentView paramters
Fixed logic error when copying a file to its output folder
data.body: Found a logic error here. If the copyToOutputDirectory string was null, the next check would throw an exception since it tries to call Equals() on it.

data.title: Fixed "Loading Content Twice" bug.
data.body:
ContentManager used to store its loaded assets by the path passed into Load<T>(). Because of this, something like "Content\Texture.xnb" and "content/Texture.XNB" would be loaded twice since it would fail the string comparison in the dictionary lookup.

Now we store content by a separate key, which is created by forcing the assetName/path to use all forward slashes and lowercase. This modified key isn't used anywhere else other than looking up already loaded assets, so it shouldn't break behavior anywhere else.

Note that this PR emulates the behavior of stock XNA, since path separators and casing don't matter on Windows.

data.title: MonoGame
data.body:
I'm running VS2013 and am able to create and build new projects but content projects don't work on VS2013. I have the XNA 4.0 VS2013 refresh installed and the latest develop build of MonoGame but when adding a content project I get a modal dialog error when creating the project:

There is a missing project subtype.
Subtype: {6D335F3A-9D43-41b4-9D22-F6F17C4BE596} is unsupported by this installation

I am able to create the exact same scenario (install just VS2012, MonoGame and the XNA Refresh) and it works (there's some manual steps to hook up the new content project to the game project but it works). On VS2013 it will not work at all.

My only option is to install VS2012 and build in that for the project instead of VS2013 which is a real PITA.

Any suggestions would be appreciated but I am not installing VS2010 or any sillyness like that. I do realize the content pipeline isn't complete but it does work for images and fonts in VS2012 (on another machine I have). I just decided to go just with VS2013 on this one but am now stuck.

Thanks
